title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message: I have Macbook Air 11, Early 2014 that works just fine without anyproblemes but the issue is with the charger light. It doesnt light up at all..

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message: No comunication with One wire circuit  I guess , inspect Magsafe board for corrosion and or flat cable or connectors....

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message: But why does it start normally if there is no communication with the one wire circuit?

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message: Because you have a charged battery

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message: No i don't. Theres no even battery attached to computer.

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message:
Have you tried alternate DC in board/dc in board flex?

The onewire circuit is on the DC in board on this model.

99% of the time it is bad flex cable,corrosion on PP3V42_G3H or SYS_ONEWIRE or SMC_BC_ACOK pins of the dc in connector. 

1% of the time it is the SMC.

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 889"]Have you tried alternate DC in board/dc in board flex?

The onewire circuit is on the DC in board on this model.

99% of the time it is bad flex cable,corrosion on PP3V42_G3H or SYS_ONEWIRE or SMC_BC_ACOK pins of the dc in connector.

1% of the time it is the SMC. [/QUOTE]

Totally agree! Had the same issue and fixed it by replacing the flex cable! The old one had burned pins.

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message: Found out what caused the problem. Seems like there is 98 prosent chance that the flex cable is bad or the dc in board. Or 1 prosent the SMC. Found out that the last prosent was corrosion on the motherboards flex cables pins and did not connect in one pins. Solderd the pin back where it belong and now it works like a charm without any issues. Thanks everybody! :)

title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
message: You can also fix the DC in board. Look at U6901 and U6900 on any unibody, then look at the dc in board. In some cases when I didn't have a dc in flex for an older air and a customer was an impatient fuck I would run all the wires from the mainboard using magnet wire to the dc in board to freshly soldered onewire circuitry... fun times. :-)
